image.altText: Man in a black shirt and grey hoodie standing outside.

items.synopsis: Aiden Aslin survived five months of torture in Russian captivity. Now free, he wants to share the story of one Ukrainian man who didn't make it out alive. WARNING: Some readers may find the details of this story distressing.

title.children: Aiden thought his Russian captors could stoop no lower as they tortured him. Then they got a camera out

image.altText: The Matildas celebrate by running towards each other near the goal.

items.synopsis: The Matildas have defeated the Republic of Ireland 1-0 in their World Cup opener on home soil after losing captain Sam Kerr to a calf injury.

title.children: Matildas defeat Ireland in World Cup opener after losing Kerr pre-game

image.altText: Sam Kerr

items.synopsis: From Sam Kerr's shock injury to New Zealand's moment of ecstasy, these are the five talking points from the opening day of the Women's World Cup.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sam Kerr injury leaves worrying hole for Matildas and NZ lethargy turns to ecstasy

image.altText: An illuminated Deloitte logo in a foyer with an arrangement of flowers beneath.

items.synopsis: A senator examining the big four consulting firms says Deloitte should be recalled over reports one of its ex-partners, David Milo, shared private military documents obtained while at the firm in order to win work for his own fledgling company.

title.children: Senator calls for Deloitte to face fresh grilling over claims ex-partner David Milo shared military documents

image.altText: man in suit with necklace

items.synopsis: Two days after his deputy rejected the idea, Tom Tate says the tourist strip can turn "Victoria's lemon ... into lemonade".

title.children: Gold Coast mayor says city prepared to host '26 Commonwealth Games, with provisos

image.altText: A fire truck driving and two people in high vis clothing walk along a busy highway.

items.synopsis: An investigation into the loss of a radioactive capsule, which sparked a frantic search and unprecedented public health warning earlier this year, clears Rio Tinto of wrongdoing.

title.children: Rio Tinto won't be held responsible for loss of tiny radioactive capsule, authorities confirm

image.altText: Zak Crawley holds his bat and helmet aloft and smiles

items.synopsis: England powers its way into a position from which it can level the Ashes series, with Zak Crawley's dominant century putting the hosts in front on day two of the fourth Test at Old Trafford.

title.children: Zak Crawley's blistering ton gives England first-innings lead on day two of Old Trafford Test

image.altText: A well dressed woman arrives at court

items.synopsis: Helen Mary Rosamond embezzled millions from the NAB to fund a life of opulence between 2013 and 2017, including luxury holidays, business-class flights, and a 50th birthday party that cost $70,000.

title.children: 'Breathtaking in its audacity': Woman who embezzled millions from NAB jailed for 15 years

image.altText: Two women wearing work attire walking past the Reserve Bank of Australia offices in Sydney.

items.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate surprises experts by dipping back to 3.5 per cent, with almost 33,000 extra people gaining jobs last month.

title.children: RBA's 'narrow path is widening': The jobs boom continues as all eyes turn back to inflation

image.altText: Ten dead after landslide in India

items.synopsis: A small mountain village in India is hit by a landslide in the middle of the night, leaving almost half of the estimated 225 residents trapped under debris up to 10 metres deep.

title.children: Landslide in India leaves 10 dead, more than 100 feared trapped

image.altText: Protesters scale a wall.

items.synopsis: Iraq asks Sweden's ambassador to leave amid fiery protests over a planned Koran burning at the Swedish Embassy in Stockholm.

title.children: Iraq expels Swedish ambassador as man desecrates Koran in Stockholm

image.altText: A young Indigenous man in a wheelchair, being wheeled out by an older man through the front of a court building's front door

items.synopsis: Peter Skeen's lawyers subpoenaed 290 reports and documents — including the internal police investigation. Dozens and dozens were either refused by NT Police or handed over with "entirely redacted" pages.

title.children: Lawyers for man shot at six times by NT officers seeking full disclosure of internal police reports

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

items.synopsis: The 22-year-old was fatally shot by officers on the side of a Queensland motorway after he came toward them holding a knife.

title.children: Man who killed elderly Brisbane couple before being shot by police was 'absolutely radicalised', inquest hears

image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

items.synopsis: The senior bureaucrat who oversaw the rollout of the Robodebt scheme is suspended without pay after the royal commission found she did "nothing of substance" after discovering illegalities.

title.children: Top bureaucrat behind Robodebt suspended from $900k job

image.altText: Andre Viljoen in his homemade jet flying above Tuross Head

items.synopsis: It started with model aeroplanes as a teenager. Then he piloted gliders. Now, retired dentist Andre Viljoen has built his own jet aircraft to see Australia's best sights.

title.children: Retiree's bird's-eye view of Australia from his homemade jet aircraft

image.altText: High speed car chase in Sydney crash

items.synopsis: Camera footage shows a car weaving in and out of traffic, hurtling through intersections, and driving on the wrong side of the road at high speeds.

title.children: 'Reckless': Firearms found in car after wild police chase through Sydney suburbs

image.altText: A black-and-white close-up of a gaunt and harrowed-looking man with a stetson hat and a cigarette in his mouth.

items.synopsis: There is only one IMAX 1570 film print of the new-release epic in the southern hemisphere, and the only two projectionists trained to show it are treating the spool like "liquid gold".

title.children: Only two people in Australia know how to show Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer in its full IMAX glory

image.altText: A woman wearing a red scarf looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: Maria Barclay was just 17 years old when she enlisted in the Australian Defence Force and has told the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide serving among very few women in the military has had traumatising consequences.

title.children: 'I didn't have a voice': Ex-servicewoman tells commission of feeling isolated after sexual assault

image.altText: A police officer stands in front of a police car.

items.synopsis: New Zealand police say the 24-year-old had no licence for the shotgun he used to carry out the attack, and that he had a history of family violence.

title.children: Man who killed two at Auckland construction site had no gun licence, NZ police confirm

image.altText: A wheat crop

items.synopsis: Global wheat prices jump $33 per tonne overnight after Russia bombs the Odesa grain port and threatens to destroy any cargo ships leaving Ukraine.

title.children: Russian bombing of grain port in Ukraine prompts global wheat price hike

image.altText: A glass pipe, used for smoking the drug ice, sits on a bench.

items.synopsis: A Cooma man who stabbed his friend more than 15 times during a paranoid drug-fuelled rage on an isolated Snowy Mountains road in 2021, has been sentenced to 24 years behind bars for his murder.

title.children: Court hears of horrific final moments of man’s life before 'brutal' murder by laughing, meth-crazed killer

image.altText: A large crocodile resting in the sun on a muddy bank

items.synopsis: Crime Stoppers and a community organisation have partnered to offer a reward and the anonymous tip service for anyone with information about the killing of two saltwater crocodiles in the Daintree.

title.children: Crime Stoppers offers $10,000 reward for information about crocodile killings

image.altText: Margot Robbie standing beside a pink convertible in a palm-tree-lined Hollywood street.

items.synopsis: In the build-up to Thursday's release of Barbie in Australian cinemas, Margot Robbie has been doing a whole bunch of promotional events — and her outfits have not disappointed fans.

title.children: A look back at the outfits Margot Robbie wore while promoting the Barbie movie

image.altText: Man with glasses sits in front of music production computer and speakers

items.synopsis: One K-pop music label is using AI to record tracks in multiple languages. So what does it mean for the music industry?

title.children: Inside the AI quest to break down K-pop language barriers

image.altText: The word Net flix in the company's font in red colour overlayed on top of a dark screenshot of the website.

items.synopsis: After a turbulent stretch of losing users, the streaming service posts one of its biggest growth in numbers for the April-June period, but analysts say it will be hard to sustain.

title.children: Netflix gains millions of subscribers following password-sharing crackdown

image.altText: A casket in a cathedral

items.synopsis: The former member for Hotham has been remembered by those who knew him as a great Australian, and a "courageous son" of the Labor movement.

title.children: Anthony Albanese labels Simon Crean 'man of decency' as mourners bid farewell to the former Labor leader

image.altText: A man looks perplexed after a rugby league match

items.synopsis: The Tigers had their moments in their 18-14 loss to the Dragons but it won't be enough to save them from another wooden spoon.

title.children: Wests Tigers slump to new low as club braces for back-to-back wooden spoons

image.altText: a vote no pamphlet featuring indigenous artwork

items.synopsis: An Indigenous artist and elder is "disgusted" that a painting he composed of Uluru has been reappropriated to help spread misinformation about the Voice to Parliament.

title.children: 'Vote No' to Voice to Parliament flyers peddling false claims under investigation by election watchdog

image.altText: A dirt-coloured cylinder is seen at the bottom of a dirt pit. Earthworks have been conducted around it, establishing walls.

items.synopsis: An unexploded, 220kg World War II-era bomb on Nauru has been defused by Australian and Nauruan authorities after it was discovered earlier this month during earthworks operations.

title.children: WWII bomb defused on Nauru after state of disaster declared, people evacuated

image.altText: An Australian female road cyclists stands with the national flag behind her while wearing her Comm Games gold medal.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has rejected suggestions by Victoria's opposition leader that the federal government did not allocate money for the Commonwealth Games in the last budget because they knew they were going to be cancelled.

title.children: Federal government did not get pre-budget warning of Games cancellation, Albanese says

image.altText: Group of dancers rehearsing in performance space

items.synopsis: One of the world's most famous cabarets has arrived in Australia in a bid to find the next batch of dancers to join the razzle and dazzle of the Moulin Rouge.

title.children: Have you got what it takes? Moulin Rouge on hunt for Australian dancers
